module.name: resource_management
module.keywords: module, resource, resource allocation, resource management

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of resource management and resource allocation.

Managed resources may have the following characteristics:
Availability of resources may be specified by quantity and location
Provision of resources may be specified using activity and quantity
Resources that is to be provided may be allocated to locations in specified quantities
Relationships between i.e. historical, actual, and planned situation of managed resources

Allocated resources may have the following characteristics:
Allocation of a resource can be specified by quantity or time interval
An allocated resource may be either a managed resource or a resource item
A resource allocation can be related back to the corresponding resource requirement.

inscope.li: Relationships between historical, actual and planned situation of resources
Relationships between allocated resources and the correspondng resource requirements.

outscope.li: Identification and detailed descriptions of maganed resources
Recording of used or consumed resources.

description.p: The Resource_management UoF provides the capability needed to record resource availability, resource provision and resource allocation.
